text.section:
The health officer for each county:
May investigate any suspected nuisance; and
Shall investigate and report on the sanitary conditions of schools, places of business, and places of employment in the county.

section.section: If the health officer finds that a nuisance exists, the health officer shall serve a written notice to the person who is causing the nuisance, ordering the person to abate the nuisance within a time specified in the notice.

The notice shall be served:
On the person who is causing the nuisance; or
If the person who is causing the nuisance cannot be found, on the owner or occupant of the property where the nuisance exists.

text.section: Failure to comply with the requirements of a notice served under this section is a violation of this subtitle.
If a question arises between health officers as to the jurisdiction or duties of a health officer in the abatement of a nuisance, the question shall be referred to the Secretary for resolution.

section.section:
A health officer may file a complaint in the circuit court for the county where the nuisance exists if:
The person served with the notice under this section fails to comply with the requirements of the notice; or
Although the person served with a notice under this section complies with the requirements of the notice, the nuisance is likely to recur on the same property.
